messages.subject: Re: if you're so inclined...will you pray?
messages.msgSnippet: You can count on my family to keep yours in our prayers. ... My dad s mother is not doing well. She has Alzheimer s and diabetes. While I was in the hospital
messages.messageBody:
You can count on my family to keep yours in our prayers.


--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, Elizabeth Roberts
<mamabethuscg@y...> wrote:
> If you're so inclined, will you please pray for me and my family?
My dad's mother is not doing well. She has Alzheimer's and diabetes.
While I was in the hospital after Gracie's birth because of the
pulmonary embolism, Gram had a UTI go septic. While in the hospital
for that she fell and broke her hip. She's been in a nursing home
since and is declining. Her hip isn't healing well and she's been
placed on a feeding tube because she is unable to swallow. Her heart
isn't the greatest either. She's spending most of her time asleep,
and rarely has any lucid moments.
>
> We are not expecting her to make it through the end of the year...
>
> Her name is Jeanette Owen.
>
> Thanks so much!
>
> MamaBeth
>
>
> Everything I need to know, I learned on my own!
>
> ---------------------------------
> Do you Yahoo!?
> Free Pop-Up Blocker - Get it now
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: if you're so inclined...will you pray?
messages.msgSnippet: ...  wrote: She s been in a nursing home since and is declining. Her hip isn t healing well and she s been placed on a feeding tube
messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, Elizabeth Roberts
<mamabethuscg@y...> wrote:
<>She's been in a nursing home since and is declining. Her hip isn't
healing well and she's been placed on a feeding tube because she is
unable to swallow.....snip, snip.....We are not expecting her to make
it through the end of the year...<>

MamaBeth:

We are dealing with the same thing. My father-in-law has been in a
nursing home for some time. His Alzheimer's has also reached the
stage where his brain no longer signals his throat to swallow, so he
keeps getting pneumonia. He forgot how to walk long ago. All agreed
to sign a DNR order and not to continue a feeding tube, which made
him eligible for the hospice wing of the nursing home. In truth he
is getting much better treatment there, but we expect he, too, will
not make it through the end of the year. We visited him last week, a
long drive. But we figure it may be the last time we see him alive.
I will hold you and your family in our prayerful and healing thoughts.

Norma

messages.subject: if you're so inclined...will you pray?
messages.msgSnippet: If you re so inclined, will you please pray for me and my family? My dad s mother is not doing well. She has Alzheimer s and diabetes. While I was in the
messages.messageBody:
If you're so inclined, will you please pray for me and my family? My dad's mother is not doing well. She has Alzheimer's and diabetes. While I was in the hospital after Gracie's birth because of the pulmonary embolism, Gram had a UTI go septic. While in the hospital for that she fell and broke her hip. She's been in a nursing home since and is declining. Her hip isn't healing well and she's been placed on a feeding tube because she is unable to swallow. Her heart isn't the greatest either. She's spending most of her time asleep, and rarely has any lucid moments.

We are not expecting her to make it through the end of the year...

Her name is Jeanette Owen.

Thanks so much!

MamaBeth


Everything I need to know, I learned on my own!
